articles.title: Microsoft is killing Remote Desktop: Use these 4 free alternatives instead
articles.author: Brian Burgess
articles.summary: Microsoft is killing off the Remote Desktop app for Windows. Luckily, there are free alternatives on the market that you can use to connect PCs and other devices remotely. RustDesk is one of the most popular remote software applications. HelpWire is an easy-to-use remote desktop app with a straightforward, responsive interface.

articles.title: 7 clever uses for silica gel packets and why you should never throw them away
articles.author: Georgia Burns
articles.summary: Silica gel packets from new bags and shoes are surprisingly useful around the house. Here are 7 clever ways to re-use them and why you should never throw them out. Silica gel packs can prevent mould, keep makeup fresh, keep razors rust free and even fix your phone.

articles.title: Scientists create biodegradable detergent with wood, corn components
articles.author: Bojan Stojkovski
articles.summary: Researchers funded by China's Key Technologies R&D Program have created a plant-based detergent made of wood fibers and corn protein that removes stains on clothes and dishes just as well as regular commercial products available in the market. Cellulose nanofibers from wood and zein protein from corn are used to create an emulsion. The research team found that at a 5% dilution, the detergent is more effective than laundry powder.

For decades, the automotive industry was an exclusive club. If you weren't Ford, Toyota or one of a handful of legacy manufacturers, you had about as much chance of starting a successful car company as winning the lottery. Then came the electric revolution that rewrote the rule book and allowed ambitious newcomers to challenge the status quo.
